wm
Interface WMInterface

All Superinterfaces:
java.rmi.Remote
All Known Implementing Classes:
WumpusMonitor, WumpusMonitor_Stub
public interface WMInterface
extends java.rmi.Remote

An interface defined to be implemented by the wumpus monitor, a view of a game in the wumpus world. It defines a series of callback methods to be invoked by the wumpus server.

Method Summary
 void currentWorld(WumpusWorld world)
          Receives an update of the entire world.

          Receives an indication that the game is over.

          Receives an indication that an agent has grabbed the gold.

          Receives an indication that an agent has shot its arrow.

          Receives an indication that an agent has turned left.

          Receives an indication that an agent has turned right.
 void walk(Agent agent)
          Receives an indication that an agent has walked.
 

Method Detail

currentWorld

public void currentWorld(WumpusWorld world)
                  throws java.rmi.RemoteException
Receives an update of the entire world. It will be invoked once in the beginning of the communication, and once in a while, to resynchronize in case of lost packages.
Parameters:
world - the world as is in the current state.
Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException - if there is an error in the communication.

gameOver

public void gameOver()
              throws java.rmi.RemoteException
Receives an indication that the game is over.
Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException - if there is an error in the communication.

          throws java.rmi.RemoteException
Receives an indication that an agent has grabbed the gold.
Parameters:
agent - the agent that grabbed the gold.
Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException - if there is an error in the communication.

join

public void join(Agent agent)
          throws java.rmi.RemoteException
Receives an indication that an agent has joined the game
Parameters:
agent - the agent that joined the game.
Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException - if there is an error in the communication.

killed

public void killed(Agent agent)
            throws java.rmi.RemoteException
Receives an indication that an agent was killed. If the agent had the gold, then the gold should be available in the same room of the agent.
Parameters:
agent - the agent that was killed.
Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException - if there is an error in the communication.
